perturbation.original_text: Following the payment of the Cash Purchase Price but subject to Agent's obligation to pay Expenses and fund the Wind-Down Payment, all Proceeds shall be the exclusive property of Purchaser, subject to further distribution among the entities comprising Purchaser pursuant to any agreements between the entities comprising Purchaser and the Second Lien Noteholders.
perturbation.changed_text: Following the payment of the Cash Purchase Price but subject to Agent's obligations to pay the Expenses and the Wind-Down Payment, all Proceeds shall be the exclusive property of Purchaser, subject to further distribution among the entities comprising Purchaser pursuant to any agreements between the entities comprising Purchaser and the Second Lien Noteholders. However, Merchant shall retain a percentage of proceeds, as determined by Merchant's discretion.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the ownership of Proceeds. The original text clearly states that Proceeds shall be the exclusive property of Purchaser, but the modified version grants the Merchant discretion to retain a percentage of Proceeds, leading to uncertainty about the division of Proceeds.

perturbation.original_text: Agent shall be authorized to abandon any and all FF&E, whether owned or not by Merchant, in place without any cost or liability to Agent. For the avoidance of doubt, Agent shall have no responsibility whatsoever with respect to FF&E that is not owned by Merchant, provided that nothing in this Section 7 shall limit Agent's rights with respect to Owned FF&E under the Asset Designation Rights or with respect to leased FF&E under the Lease/Contract Designation Rights.
perturbation.changed_text: Agent shall be authorized to abandon any and all FF&E, whether owned or not by Merchant, in place without any cost or liability to Agent. For the avoidance of doubt, Agent shall have no responsibility whatsoever with respect to FF&E that is not owned by Merchant, and Agent will retain responsibility for FF&E that is not owned by Merchant, provided that nothing in this Section 7 shall limit Agent's rights with respect to Owned FF&E under the Asset Designation Rights or with respect to leased FF&E under the Lease/Contract Designation Rights.
perturbation.explanation: The change adds 'and Agent will retain responsibility for FF&E that is not owned by Merchant', which contradicts the original text's statement that 'Agent shall have no responsibility whatsoever with respect to FF&E that is not owned by Merchant'. This creates uncertainty regarding Agent's responsibility for non-owned FF&E.

perturbation.original_text: Agent shall accept Merchant's gift certificates, gift cards, store credits, return credits, or similar merchandise credits issued by Merchant (collectively, "Gift Certificates") for a period of ten days from and including the Sale Commencement Date. Thereafter, Agent shall have no obligation to accept Gift Certificates. Agent's acceptance of Gift Certificates shall not impact the Wind-Down Budget or the Wind-Down Cap.
perturbation.changed_text: Agent shall accept Merchant's gift certificates, gift cards, store credits, return credits, or similar merchandise credits issued by Merchant (collectively, "Gift Certificates") for a period of ten days from and including the Sale Commencement Date. Thereafter, Agent shall have the option to accept Gift Certificates. Agent's acceptance of Gift Certificates shall not impact the Wind-Down Budget or the Wind-Down Cap.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly stated that Agent has no obligation to accept gift certificates after 10 days, however the modified version introduces the phrase "Agent shall have the option to accept Gift Certificates.", making it unclear whether to accept or not, potentially impacting the enforcement of which one is true.
